abstract: New York City officials announce agreement to pay over $5 million in separate lawsuits filed by families of Jason Echevarria and Carlos Mercado, inmates of Rikers Island who died while in custody.
lead_paragraph: The settlements involve Jason Echevarria, who died in after ingesting a soap packet at the jail complex, and Carlos Mercado, who died of complications from diabetes within 15 hours of arriving there.

headline.main: City to Pay $5.3 Million to End Suits Over 2 Rikers Inmates’ Deaths
headline.print_headline: City Agrees to Settle Suits Over Deaths of 2 Rikers Inmates for $5.3 Million

snippet: The settlements involve Jason Echevarria, who died in after ingesting a soap packet at the jail complex, and Carlos Mercado, who died of complications from diabetes within 15 hours of arriving there.
